name: Bally's Las Vegas

reviews.text: First, thank-you to the traveler who suggested carrying a picture of the (North Tower) room from the website; only this saved me from getting thrown into the South Tower or else pay extra $20/night to stay in N. Tower. However, the clerk “got me back”. Instead of a king bed, I got a queen and I was assigned to the 7th flr, with zero views.
reviews.title: Not bad, not great
Fine Hotel
reviews.text: Overall, the room was decent so I accepted these minor irritations. PROS: Bathroom well-furnished and well-lit. In fact, excellent lighting throughout all areas for working at the 2 desks or reading in bed. Modern décor. Nice toiletries. CONS: Bedding was disappointing – 3 small pillows, no shams. A/C extremely noisy when it kicks in. No extras like bathrobe, coffeemaker, mini-fridge, CD player.

Bally’s location on center Strip is an advantage. Connection to Paris Hotel and opposite to Bellagio is a bonus. Bally’s relatively small size also turned out to be advantageous – you don’t walk too far to reach the lobby, the elevator or your room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Bally's - North Tower Room
Nice Place To Stay
reviews.text: But location is all there is to recommend about Bally’s. None of its restaurants rate a visit - ordinary yet still expensive. The casino itself is small with less slots than others. Restrooms are rather tired.

reviews.title: Great service from a great hotel
reviews.text: Wrt service, a late checkout was extended to 1pm - which any hotel in the world would do, so again, very ordinary. FYI, you can check out until 6pm but you pay an extra $45.

The hotel is centrally located which is handy for walking (which you will do a lot of). The mono rail stops here and that is a plus. Bally's connects directly to the Paris which is wonderful. The NORTH TOWER rooms I were in are very, very nice. I saw two rooms in the SOUTH TOWER. One was a suite and it was nice. The other room I saw in the SOUTH TOWER was a basic, two bed hotel room and looked run down, although it had a great view. So I recommend staying in the NORTH TOWER or in a newly refurbished suite in the SOUTH TOWER. Check rates carefully as some nights were nearly half the price of others.
reviews.title: North Tower is Best; Centrally Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at Bally's. We had a non-smoking, king room in the North tower. After reading some other posts, I think the North tower might be the difference. We couldn't believe the size of the room, it was huge. The furniture, carpeting, bed, bathroom, etc. all were updated. We were very happy with the room. We've stayed in many LAS hotels and would absolutely return to Bally's.
reviews.title: Happy with the North Tower Room

likes.disliked: — View of side street instead of strip

reviews.text: The Bally's location is perfect and hard to beat. Right in the middle of everything, across from Bellagio, next to Paris and Planet Hollywood, across from Flamingo and Ceasar's. It's especially nice to have access from inside the Bally's casino directly into the Paris casino.
reviews.title: Nice room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a more up-scale experience or celebrity sightings, you should probably choose another hotel. But Bally's was perfect for a nice room to stay, and a good location to carouse the LAS Strip.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and Casino

reviews.text: Huge hotel and room. not too old or new. Nice view of the LV strip at night with lights. Nice clean bathroom and spacious too. Friendly hotel staff who did my check in.
reviews.title: Bally's, the perfect location

reviews.text: Stayed two nights at Bally's, comped from a mail offer. I was given a "Grand" Suite, in the South tower.
reviews.title: Good Stay at Bally's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very large, with a large raised bath area. The room had not been renovated in some time, but was clean and comfortable. Slept very well in the king size bed.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The raised bath area had a soaking (non-jetted) tub in the middle, with closets and sinks on both sides. A small room on one side contained the toilet, and a bidet was in a small room on the other side. A walk in shower was behind the tub, separated from it by a wall. The towels were large and plush. There was a safe in one of the closets, with a $3 a day charge to use.
reviews.title: Very pleased with Ballys

reviews.text: The view from the room was of the Paris Hotel pool deck, and you could see the Bellagio fountains off to the right.
reviews.title: Central Location on Strip

reviews.text: No complaints about the room. Despite the dated decor, it was well worth the $0 I paid. Bally's is in a great central strip location. Good choices for food in the hotel, and nearby. I would definitely stay here again, especially if comped!
reviews.title: Ballys Please pass over this Hotel....needs remodeling

reviews.text: I will preface by saying this was my second visit to Vegas and I was on a business trip for a trade show at Bally's. The reason I stayed at Bally's was because it's convention center hosted the trade show my $60Billion dollar company was participating in. I have traveled extensively in numerous hotels across the world from Istanbul to Islip and this was one of the worst I have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I liked:
reviews.title: Major Overhaul Needed

reviews.text: The room was large.
reviews.title: Bally's - A great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I did not like:
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Dirty room (dusty furniture and moldy shower tiles) with furniture that looked like it was from the Salvation Army! This was the type of room that made me want to sleep with my shoes on!
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Bally's in Las Vegas twice--once on our way to the Grand Canyon and again on our way back. The two stays could not have been more different--this review is for the first stay, February 19-20.
reviews.title: SOUTH TOWER, dreadful. Just dreadful.

reviews.text: It is important to note that Bally's is essentially TWO DIFFERENT HOTELS. We were assigned a room in the SOUTH TOWER which is characterized by ancient furniture (70's style, but not retro cool by any stretch of the imagination) and unbelievably bad housekeeping. We viewed rooms on the 18th and 20th floors.
reviews.title: All Round GREAT stay!

reviews.text: We had asked for a non-smoking king room, and we were assigned a non-smoking room with two queen beds. Our first room had some sticky substance all over the flat surfaces, so we phoned the front desk and asked for another room. After an interminable slog down the endless, dark, dingy corridors littered with room service detritus, we got another room--and this one had shards of broken glass and pennies on the carpeting. We tried the front desk once more and asked if there were any "updated" rooms. We were told that the only rooms available in the North Tower were suites for $100 per night more, and that we basically had the best option we were going to get since the hotel was quite full. We were offered the chance to switch to a king room on the same floor the following day, if one became available. We finally gave up, went to the nearby Walgreen's and bought a giant can of Lysol disinfectant, then hoped for the best.
reviews.title: Good location, tired rooms, high minimums

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fortunately, the linens had been changed, but be aware that these beds do not have anything resembling a bedspread/coverlet/duvet/comforter--they have a double-sheeted blanket and a weird little strip of fabric that goes over the foot of the bed. If you like a really firm mattress, then you're in luck, but if you're used to a plush or pillow-top mattress, these beds will come as a shock.
reviews.title: bed bugs in junior suite - i could not believe it!

likes.liked: — Very spacious, beautiful junior suite, great view of the Paris Eiffel tower
likes.disliked: — Bed Bugs and bites as a result

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower had plexiglas doors instead of a shower curtain, which prove difficult to clean for even the most detail-oriented housekeeping staff, so be prepared for mold and mildew. Several tiles in the bathroom had been cracked or broken, adding to the overall shabby appearance.
reviews.title: Super Bowl Sunday

likes.disliked: — High table limits, and GIANTS FOOTBALL FANS

reviews.text: My wife and I rang in 2006 at Ballys. Our stay was between Dec 29-Jan 1. What a blast! If anyone has considered spending New Years Eve in Las Vegas and haven’t had a chance, make it a point to go. It is one NON STOP PARTY! I am 45; my wife is 46, so we aren’t kids. But we like to have a good time. We socialized with everyone from 21 years old to 70. The only difference between us and the 20 year olds is that we required naps. Everyone we encountered was smiling, drinking, and just having a great time! More about the party later.
reviews.title: Happy New Year 2006 at Ballys
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: As usual, we left Connecticut at 5am, got into airport at 10:50am Nevada time. If you take the taxi to Ballys and he takes you through the tunnel, don’t tip him! He is taking the long way and he is ripping you off. Cab fair should about 12 bucks and the drive should be from Paradise to Flamingo to Ballys. Limos are typically $75.00 one way.

Arriving at Ballys we had our bags taken from the bellman and preceded to the check in desk about 11:20am. The line was long but moved very fast. We got to the desk about 10 minutes and were given our complimentary room in the South Tower. Other people we heard had to wait for their room but we had no problem checking in early once again. This could contribute to a smoking room request. Called the bellman to bring up our bags, and he arrived at our door ten minutes later. Tipped the bell hop and got ready for the day.
reviews.title: Great central location & space!

reviews.text: I have read some complaining about the South Tower. Granted, it is not as new as the North Tower but there are no problems with Housekeeping at all! Some people are harder to please. They should go another hotel at 300 dollar a night. But if you are in Vegas, how long are you staying in the room, anyways? Since the room is free, I usually end up in the older tower. But it has always been clean and the king size bed is roomy and comfortable. If you want a view of the strip you must request it.
reviews.title: Happy New Year in the Ballys

reviews.text: The shower was missing the floor mat. I asked one of the maids the next room over to get me one so I don’t slip and break my head while showering. Five minutes later she knocked on the door with the mat with a smile on her face. I tipped her a five dollar bill and she was so thankful, her smile turned into a glow. They work very hard for very little money.
reviews.title: Bed, Bathroom, Location

reviews.text: I enjoyed 6 nights at Ballys in the beginning of May. had comps for 5 nights, (Sun thru Thurs.) and paid $34 for the last night. (Fri.) Check in was fast, as i am fortunate to be Platinum, so no one in line. (this was around 10:00am) i was upgraded to North tower, but didn't want to wait for a room, (came with a bad cold, and wasn't feeling very good after the flight.). so Von, the agent, offered me immediate occupancy of a handicapped room, which I gratefully took.
reviews.title: Bally's, my home away from home....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basically the same as a reg. room, but the bathroom was much larger, with a "wheel in " shower. Also had a refrigerator and a coffee pot. The room was a bit worn, some stains on the carpet, but clean, bed very comfortable, small table with chairs, desk with chair, and small lounge chair. It was on the 22 floor, and view of the roof and parking lot, but as I have been to Vegas many times, I didn't care about the view.
reviews.title: Stay at your own risk!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't eat at too many of the restaurants, but did get a great sub from Nosh, plus used room service several times, and was very happy with the service, quality of food and prices. For breakfast several times i want to the buffet in the walkway towards paris.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used the Monorail one day, back and forth several times, and didn't find it too much of a walk from my room in the North tower.
reviews.title: Large, quiet rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all i enjoyed my stay at Ballys, even tho I was not feeling all that great, so stayed pretty much in Ballys for my gambling. Great CW service, and everyone I came in contact with, housekeeping, desk staff, security, etc. gave wonderful service, and were very caring.
reviews.title: Great Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay at Bally's. Following the advice on this website we asked for a North Tower room and were not disappointed. Very spacious room with a very nice, clean bathroom. Without exception, every staff member was extremely friendly and pleasant. The housekeeping service was great. No matter what time of day we left our room, our room was straightened when we came back.
reviews.title: Very Nice Room. Friendly Staff

reviews.text: A word of advice, do not pay the outrageous $4 charge for the water bottles in your room. There is a convenience store just a short walk away, with bottled water for 0 .79. Also, downstairs, on the way to the pool, there is an inexpensive Deli where everything we tried was excellent.
reviews.title: North Tower Only!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I waited in line to check in for 50minutes!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: A better deal than the Mirage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I made my reservation I requested the NORTH TOWER ONLY and a non-smoking room.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.text: On check in I was told that the only room available was in the south tower and was a smoking room 5450. I was very tired and all the hotels were full so I took it.
reviews.title: Surprise upgade - a dream come true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great rate with a Hot Deal and stayed from Monday - Friday. Excellent location if you want to walk the strip and visit the other hotels. Check in was easy, room extra large with king size bed, bathroom also clean with nice amenities. We had a view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. We liked having the elevators to the rooms close to the entrance of the hotel as our feet were tired by the end of the day.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a great location

reviews.text: Pool was nice, but nothing spectacular. Being attached to the Paris hotel & casino is a real bonus. In terms of gambling, we found the Ballys machines to be very tight and prefered to go over to Paris and play the machines.
reviews.title: Great stay at Bally's

reviews.text: Food court was nothing special - we tried the pizza and ice cream. Paris has more selection for places to eat.
reviews.title: Excellent - would recommend!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Luxor on Sunday night and would recommend staying at
reviews.title: Bally's - a pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ballys over the Luxor if you like convenience.
reviews.title: Bally's sucks!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bally's is in an excellent location on the Strip in Las Vegas, but the rooms are terribly outdated and dingy. The Bellagio is across the street and Paris is right next door, so there is access to much nicer casinos and restaurants without a long walk. Our room was spacious and we got a good deal on it, which helped make the stay more tolerable. If we ever return to Vegas (I hope not to), I would spend a bit more money to stay in a nicer place. The casino at Bally's does have good, inexpensive gambling, though the interior was dark and even more depressing than most other casinos we visited.
reviews.title: Fine for Budget Travelers

reviews.text: Great hotel! The room was clean and had plenty of room for two people. We stayed in the north tower and the floor was quiet. The staff was very friendly and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is located right in the middle of the strip which made it easy if you had to go in either direction. I will stay here again!
reviews.title: Large Clean Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the north tower - very nice clean room and great view (our room caught views of the Bellagio fountain! The location is awesome - right in the heart of the strip. Was great being able to walk everywhere without having to deal with the traffic.We looked at many places but this was the best deal we could find for the location. Previous trips to Vegas we stayed at Circus Circus but thats too far away from the main action. Highly recommend Bally's
reviews.title: Great value and location!

reviews.text: Location was great. Right in the middle of the strip. Across the street from Bellagio hotel and the fountains. Reasonable rates for what you get. Rooms in the south tower in dire need of make over. Rooms in the north tower were a lot better. Still nothing fancy. Beds were very uncomfortable and need to be updated. Lots of choices for food. Also a monorail station in back of hotel. Walkway in between Ballys and Paris hotels was very convenient. Front desk staff very helpful. Everyone there very friendly.
reviews.title: Great location, right in the middle of strip.

reviews.text: I would definitely consider staying here again especially if they get new beds.
reviews.title: Filthy carpet and old furnishings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Bally’s from Fri 25 May to Mon 28 May (Memorial weekend) after getting a nice deal through Expedia for around $109 per night.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read some of the mixed reviews about Bally’s so did have some concerns about what we may end up with – we did call a few days before arriving to request a North Tower suite and make sure we got non smoking.
reviews.title: great stay at Bally's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in around 8pm on the Fri we arrived and the clerk said all they had was South Tower and smoking rooms. After a couple of minutes she did manage to find us a suite that met our original request.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Very thin walls in the room

reviews.text: The suites were actually very spacious and the bathrooms in particular was very large. The suites were clean and had all the standard amenities you would expect. The bed was quite hard which some people may dislike.
reviews.title: Just Ok This Year

reviews.text: The walls are a bit thin as we could hear constantly talking and laughing in the next room – wasn’t too bad though.
reviews.title: Meh. Many errors made by Bally's staff

reviews.text: During the trade show time- got a good rate thru Expedia.com. Reserved a deluxe room which is $30 more per night than a standard room. Tried checking in around 2pm the room wasn't ready. (Told the check-in time is 4pm). Came back around 5pm and the room was still not ready. Had to settle with stinking smoking room. The deluxe room had pretty much no amenities like coffee maker, bottled water, bathrobes, feather blanket. Inside the quality is simiar to a motel other than hi-speed internet. The location is nice but that is about it. Would not opt to come back.
reviews.title: Go Somewhere Else!

reviews.text: My friend and I booked our stay at Bally's through a website. When we got there we were offered a Deluxe room at an additional $20per day. The deluxe rooms were renovated with additional amenities and better views. We agreed to this, but then were told that the room would not be ready until 3 pm. We agreed to return at that time and check in. When we returned, we were told our room was given away and there was only the lower floors available. We were upset by this since we agreed to what we were offered to begin with, and then we waited for 3 hours to get it. To compensate us the manager offered to only charge us for three nights of the upgrade price rather than the five days we were staying. At this point we had no other choice but to take that offer. The day before we checked out we looked at our bill and saw that the bill included charges for five days of the upgraded $20/day. We called the front desk, spoke with that manager and went through the whole story again. He agreed to take off the 2 days like we originally agreed to. Then at check out time, you guessed it. The full charges for the five days were back on the bill again. We went through the whole thing again for the third time. This manager was not helpful at all. He kept insisting there was nothing he could do about it. I told him to speak with the two other managers who already agreed to removing the two additional night charges. He said he would look into it and email me what he finds out. That was two days ago and I have not received an email, nor have I received my reduced compensations that was promised upon check in.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

likes.disliked: — The hassles with the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel for any reason. The "Deluxe" room didn't look any different than any other room. It did not have any extras, the carpet was stained, there were no bedspreads. It was a total waste of money. The view was of the rooftop with lights shining right into our window. And they are so disorganized, they don't even know what each other is doing because they don't put notes in the computer to verify what they have promised the guests.
reviews.title: No major complaints

reviews.text: We stayed at Bally's in a standard North Tower room for three nights in December 2008. Unfortunately when we checked in, we were informed that they did not have any non-smoking rooms available for us with a king-sized bed. Our choices were a smoking room in the north tower, or a queen-sized non-smoking in the older South Tower. Fortunately for us, the smoking room turned out not to have a lingering smell and overall was extermely clean and spacious with flawless furniture. On one of the three nights we did perceive a heavy odor of smoke evidently from one of the adjacent rooms that share an air vent, but the that was just once. Overall the room was large and well-appointed for the price, although a lack of mini-fridge was at times inconvenient.
reviews.title: Bad experience in Bally's

reviews.text: I would say that the primary reason to stay at Bally's (or indeed to visit Vegas) is not to linger in the room. In that respect, this hotel/casino has several advantages. First, it is rather well located for exploring some of the more ostentatious nearby properties (e.g. the Bellagio is directly across the street, Paris is immediately adjacent, etc). In fact, Paris is directly connected to Bally's casino (and shares a parking garage) and we found that our daily routine involved coming down the elevator, bisecting the casino floor and heading directly into Paris for their excellent breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: No problem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have chose to stay in this hotel due to its good locality but was disappointed with their customer service during our arrival. We reached the hotel earlier in the morning around 8am and we went to the front desk to ask whether we can check in. Almost immediately, we are put off with the bad altitude with the front desk (at the platinum check in) as she replied in a impatient manner to tell us to check in after 11am only. After we check in around 5pm, we went back to the front desk to ask some question and the response was "can't you see i am serving other customers, can you wait?". Overall, their front desk customer service needs improvement.
reviews.title: Good location but terrible customer service

reviews.text: For the rooms, it is pretty standard and we are ok with the rooms. However, there are not much of good shows in the hotel like those in the nearby hotels.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay...Especially Location

reviews.text: Will not stay there again and would choose hotel like Planet Hollywood instead.
reviews.title: Amazing rooms, rates, and attention to detail!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Bally's for 3 nights the 3rd week of April. I had never been to Vegas before, so I chose Bally's for the location. Bill's Gambling Hall is on the opposite corner, and many friends were staying there. I noticed that Bally's was only $60 more for the entire stay as compared to Bill's (Who advertises the lowest stay on the strip). Online booking was easy, I only had one person in front of me at check in, and getting to my room was easy. I chose Bally's because of all of the ammenities, location, and price. The only downside was that the escalator at the entrance was broken 3 of the days I was there to I had to take a detour when I wanted to get to the sidewalk on the strip. I would stay at Bally's again.
reviews.title: Good Stay at Ballys

reviews.text: My stay at Bally's went above and beyond my expectations. My room was huge! I requested a room with one queen bed instead of two and had a large sitting area, table and chairs, and two desks. The room was extremely clean. Everyday, the staff made sure the room looked great. The location was wonderful! It's right on the strip and the monorail is right there. I would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The convenience of the location was great, the staff, the cleanliness.. everything. But the bed was awful. We got a room with a king size bed and the mattress plain and hard. I don't even think it had a small pillow top. We were in Vegas for 5 days... the only mar in the trip was a stiff back.
reviews.title: Everything was great except the bed

reviews.text: Oh. It also would've been nice if there was a complimentary coffee pot in the room, and if internet access wasn't so expensive.
reviews.title: Great price and pet friendly!

reviews.text: While driving to California from Texas, we knew stopping in Las Vegas was a MUST! We booked a room at Bally's online for about $42 for a Sunday night. We had our 3 year old, 4 pound Yorkie with us also. We were put on the 7th Floor of the North Tower which I guess is the floor for people who brought their pets. You could hear dogs barking down the hallway but once inside our room, we couldn't hear any outside noise.There was a small walk from the parking garage to the lobby of Bally's but it is not a bad little walk. The room was pretty big, very clean and they even included treats and water/food dishes for our dog. The bed was comfortable and the room provided a perfect night sleep. Overall, I would stay here again if the room rates are so cheap!
reviews.title: Clean, great location, 80's explosion!

reviews.text: Bally's is right in heart of the strip and the location is unbeatable. The rooms are large, very clean but stuck in the 80's. The hotel is perfect if you're doing Vegas on a budget and you want to be right in the center of everything but don't expect fancy. All in all, the rates can be great and you get the Vegas experience without the Vegas prices.
reviews.title: Not horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Bally's for 3 nights. When we arrived, there was a long lineup to check in - only one person checking in non-priority guests. Although we'd requested a non-smoking room upon booking, we were told there were none left. It wasn't pleasant - the room reeked of stale cigarettes.
reviews.title: Very nice staff . . . spacious but tired rooms

reviews.text: On the whole, I find that Bally's was a competent hotel with no major negatives and with an excellent location smack in the middle of the strip.
reviews.title: Great place to stay on my first trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time we have stayed in this hotel,we thought the first time was good but this time was even better.The line for check in was quite long and it took about twenty minutes to get to the desk ,but once there it took just a couple of minutes to get checked in.We tried the twenty dollar tip ploy and got a free upgrade to a room in the smarter north tower with great views over the strip. Last time there we were in the south tower ,now this was a little dated and in need of a revamp but still great value for money, but the north tower has had its revamp and was very nice. The room was huge with a king size bed , sofa ,glass and wooden tables and chairs,plenty of chests of drawers, tv in a huge cabinet and a large bathroom and a bonus of a coffee maker with free coffee cream and sugar replenished every day.Ballys is not the biggest or most modern hotel and casino in las vegas but its position right in the middle of the strip can't be beaten for the price.Maid service was excellent with the room cleaned everyday and all the staff that we came in contact with were very helpful and polite.Cant wait to go back to vegas and to Ballys where we got good value for our money
reviews.title: Great value in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was very wary about staying at Bally's expecting the worst and was very pleasantly surprised. We arrived at check in to find a long line up but there were lots of agents and we moved very quickly. I asked if I could have a renovated room and the agent said yes and gave it to us without charge. We were in the north tower on a non smoking floor and the room was great. The cleaning staff were very good and there was even a coffee maker in the room. In our package was also a free 24 hour voucher for the buffets. However we did not use this as we don't like long lines. We paid $3. daily for the use of the safe.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area has limited shade but had lots of chairs. The prices for food and drink were reasonable. The mexican restaurant had good food and beer and reaonably priced. The hotel is in a great location in the middle of the strip. I did find the casino very smokey and wished there were no smoking areas.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, comfortable beds, older crowd

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: CHECKOUT SERVICE

reviews.text: I am 43 and I felt like a teenager here. The crowd was definitely of the more mature age group. Even the cocktail waitresses and bartenders seemed older. The rooms were nice though - very large, comfortable beds. I was able to get this room for a pretty good discount, so I think I got a pretty good buy. We did a lot of gambling in its sister hotel, Paris, and it was so close to Caesars and the middle strip hotels, making it convenient.
reviews.title: I was very disappointed with my room and the service I recieved.
poker
reviews.text: Like others I received a room upgrade at check in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and very comfortable. What I really wanted to report was the terrific staff of the poker room. I was made to feel welcome, the games were good and my luck wasn't so bad either. All in all, I thought Bally's was a good value.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay at Bally's!

likes.disliked: — Only a very small thing... being charged for the room safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Von Kluck
reviews.title: North tower great for a saturday night

reviews.text: We arrived at Bally's at around 9 am on 7/11. We figured that a room would not be available so early on a Friday, so we checked our luggage with the bellman. The check-in line was open and the wait was about 5 minutes. The front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient. We asked for a North tower room (preferring a renovated room over a view), which was provided. We were advised to return later when the room was ready to pick up the keys.
reviews.title: Very Pleased, Indeed

reviews.text: We returned a little before noon and our room was ready. We were very pleased with the room. It was a non-smoking king, as requested, and had not a hint of smokiness. The location was on the12th floor, with another room only on one side of us and an emergency stairwell on the other side (It was nice and quiet throughout our stay). The room was large, clean, bright, and in great condition. At first we thought the mattress seemed too firm and we thought it was going to be uncomfortable, but we actually slept great. The bathroom was a comfortable size, with a tub/shower combo. The sundries included the basic shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, and a compact wall mount Conair hairdryer. One thing we weren't used to was the $3 charge to use the room safe, oh well, guess it's worth it. Our view was basically of the back of the Paris. We could see a glimpse of the Paris Eiffel Tower between buildings and, standing at the window, an angled partial glimpse of the Bellagio fountains. Not a great view… we have had better, but we have also had worse!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay at Ballys - North Tower

likes.liked: — Very clean and comfortable and a great location on the strip.

reviews.title: FANTASTIC LOCATION - A TRUELY AMAZING HOLIDAY
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I spent 3 days in Vegas and paid $300 for our AMAZING room

reviews.title: Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: in the beautiful ballys hotel on the strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off - WHAT A VIEW!!! our huge window had a perfect view of the eiffel
reviews.title: A Real Winner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: tower in the adjoining paris hotel, the bellagio fountains, down the strip
reviews.title: Center of Strip Bally's as a Home Base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as far as the eye could see and was spectacular at night!
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: Got a great price at Bally's through tripres.com which included some free show tickets and coupons. The hotel shows its age, but it is in a great location and has a newer tower. It is pretty much right in the middle of the strip across the street from The Bellagio. There are several places to eat without leaving the building and some cute shops underground. It is also connected to The Paris Hotel ( underground).
reviews.title: Older hotel, but great location

reviews.text: Also, Bally's has one of the 7 monorail stops. The monorail goes to several of the hotels.
reviews.title: It's Vegas, so you're not supposed to spend time in the hotel room...

reviews.text: And Bally's takes this sentiment to heart. This place has three things going for it: central location, cheap price, and a surprisingly good Thai restaurant. Do those make up for everything else? Frankly, not. The hotel is worn and tired: the beds sag, one desk chair splintered into pieces, the TV was 20+ years old, the toilet barely flushed. The carpets are worn - the hallways aren't even level anymore which is a bit odd - and the whole place has a dank, musty smell. We "upgraded" to a "junior suite," which is Bally-nese for a huge dumb room with a wet bar - it was a cheap upgrade and provided a much-welcome fridge.
reviews.title: Filthy with poor customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Need service? Call the front desk - nobody even answers the maid service, room service, or maintenance buttons on the phone - they ring unanswered. No sheet on the mattress? There's one in the closet, you can make it yourself (!). I did see a carpet cleaning machine wandering the hallways, but the carpets are so worn that the patterns are actually disappearing - you just can't clean something like a 20-year old carpet and get a good result.
reviews.title: Difficult to Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After checking in mid afternoon I left for the evening to return home to smelly black sludge on a 4'x6 section of carpet and all over the vanity. I called down to the front desk who said "okay, we'll send room service." I said I didn't want to deal with the noise or stink so they said come down to the front desk. I re-packed, trudged downstairs, stood in line, explained the situation again, and with no apology or sypathy, was isssued a key for a room one floor up.
reviews.title: 5 days in Vegas
NEW ATTITUDE AT BALLYS SINCE TAKEOVER
reviews.text: Booked through Expedia to visit Ballys on the strip Las vegas,sent e-mail and phoned to request a small refrigerator to keep my insulin in as I am diabetic,the response I got was, ask at check in and the charge will be 10 dollars per day.I COULD BUY A FRIDGE FOR THAT!!!!!!!´hence I spoke to expedia and changed my reservation to the Luxor who said they could accomodate my request free of charge.Lastly I then sent e-mail to Ballys asking if they charge for use of wheel chair ramps or any other thing relating to people with ´special needs´? WHACH THIS SPÀCE
Stayed at Ballys Sept 5th to September 11th, two rooms in North Tower, one with view of Flamingo/Barbary Coast. Check in and out, no problem, busy but queues moved fast.
reviews.title: Ballys - Go On - It's Better Than You Think
Cheap for superb location
reviews.text: Friendly Hotel, especially Cashier staff who were more helpful than reception, and Security who helped during an emergency. Clean, perfectly located, monorail a bonus. Played roulette at Barbary Coast, more relaxed atmosphere and low stakes, got lucky on the slots at Ballys. Booked direct through Ballys website, excellent rates, paid exactly rates quoted, no extras.

reviews.title: Great Trip, Nice Location
reviews.text: Visited most hotels, very nice, very big, could not find the exit at MGM. Ballys is in the best location, it is small enough to get around, it is friendly and clean.
Can't wait to return, and WILL stay at BALLYS.
reviews.title: Great Location, Clean Rooms, Good Price
Very poor...hidden charges never again
reviews.text: We were their to celebrate the double wedding so a total of six adults in late November 2008.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the reservations were wrong for all three rooms booked and after some discussion we were able to pay $100.00 per couple for a room upgrade. Room was large enough and the windows were still dirty (see previous review). We have stayed in many hotels worldwide as well as several in Vegas and I must say we were disappointed in Ballys. This hotel is a "nickel and dime" operation charging guests extra for every service and convenience. Want wine glasses in your room (standard everywhere else) that is $2.00 per glass. corkscrew...another $2.00! If you stay for a few days, they may get around to cleaning your room by 7pm. Don't expect much though...just clean towels. Never again for us!
reviews.title: Good Stay for a Great Price

reviews.text: Checked in on the 16th Nov, 5 mins in line at 2.30pm. We had booked through the Hot Deals section using our TRC from previous trips weekdays $40 weekends $90, these rates were secured by keeping an eye on the rates and calling to amend when they fell.
reviews.title: Lack of slots

reviews.text: I knew that our room rate was for a South Tower room, which I would be happy to take even though the rooms are very dated they are large and if you can get a high odd numbered room offer great views I really wanted the North Tower and the coverted coffee maker.
reviews.title: Classic Vegas

likes.liked: — Very convenient location, middle of the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lady at check in confirmed we were booked for the South Tower, I asked about a North Tower room and was quoted $20 per night, we had 12 nights booked so I declined and just asked for the best ST room she had available. The best was a low floor probably looking over a garbage can after an 11hr flight I smiled again and said thats ok whatever you can give us, we need to wash and sleep. At this point I don't know whether she took pity on me or saw that I was going to tip her for being so pleasant despite what room we got, our keys were given to us with a smile I thanked her and she leaned over and said you have your NT room.
reviews.title: Great new rooms

reviews.text: I did notice a few flaws in the room: peeling wallpaper along the bottom of the window; partially plugged shower head; chips out of the toilet seat; chipped paint on the bathroom shelves. Also, dirty exterior windows which is a common complaint and to be expected when you can see the airport from your hotel.
reviews.title: Great price, room, and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bally's is in a prime location in the centre of the strip. It was ideal for my first trip as it allowed me to explore the south strip on foot and the north strip and downtown by monorail/bus.
reviews.title: Great...Loved it.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I walked south to Excalibur several times (only Luxor and Mandalay Bay are further south). Going north is a longer trip and Bally's has a monorail station, plus the Deuce (bus) has a stop right in front of Bally's on Las Vegas Blvd..
reviews.title: Fine place to stay

likes.disliked: — minor peeve that no coffee making facilities are available

reviews.title: Vegas Classic
reviews.text: The casino was busy at all times of the day. It is one of the smaller ones I saw which makes the hotel easy to navigate. There are restaurants, shops and the sportsbook along the walkway to the monorail.

I traveled with 8 other extended family members last week to Las Vegas and we all stayed at Ballys, where some of were comped and the others had good rates...I am suffering with a leg problem and the staff couldn't have been nicer to me the whole trip. First off the fellow at the check in suggested I take a handicapped room, which as it turned out was a marvelous idea...It is in such a great location and the casino is small enough that you don't get lost and can easily find your friends...I also had good luck with the slots when I played them..
reviews.title: Wonderful help at Ballys in Las Vegas

reviews.text: I know some of you don't care for Bally's, but we certainly had no regrets staying there.We were all well taken care of...
reviews.title: Clean Room, Good Service, GREAT Value

reviews.text: I was in town for a convention at Caesars Palace. Ballys is just across the street and their rates were SO much better. William at the check-in desk was very accomodating. I got a great room on the 24th floor. Housekeeping was very attentive. The room was serviced well each day and was clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was a little worried. However, there was no reason to be. I tipped the front deck 20 dollars and got upgrade to the north tower. The room was huge,clean and had a lovely updated bathroom. It was also very quiet and the room was made up first thing in the morning. The location of this hotel is excellent! The pool was nice, we go some shade and it was very quiet and relaxing. On my last stay in Vegas we stayed at he Signature Hotel at the MGM Grand and it was wonderful. However, Bally's is half the price and the location is way better.I would definitely stay a Bally's again on my next trip!
reviews.title: no problems

reviews.text: We booked through Vegas.com for 3 nights. Upon check-in we asked for an upgrade to a remodeled unit. We were given a suite with a partial view of the Bellagio for $20 extra per night. The room was very nice. One perk that we weren't expecting was having a small coffee maker in the bathroom. That was really nice to have. We also got 2 free 24 hour buffet passes good at any of the Harrah's buffets. The buffet for Bally's was actually in the Paris section. The lines were lengthy at times, but so well worth the wait. We spent at least 70% of our time at Bally's. A trip over to the Rio for the WSOP and down to Fremont was all the traveling we did. They provide free shuttles between Bally's and the Rio. From the Rio you can go to another hotel or two within the Harrah's group. The only downside was the timeshare people and some of the kiosk people in the mall area below the casino.
reviews.title: Good Value, Prime Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree totally with the previous review. We were in the North tower. Our room was very nice also,however our view was of the roof,and, we could see part of the pool.We had minor issues with the door lock( our room cards wouldn't swipe),and, the safe needed a new battery pack. Both were taken care of almost immediately.
reviews.title: Bally's not a huge beast.

reviews.text: The staff is very polite,and,efficient..
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a not elaborate breakfast,and, Italian buffet in the Sidewalk cafe. . Both were inexpensive,and, good.Stayed here two times in a row. Casino is small,which is fine with us ! The best part of the hotel is the location..
reviews.title: much much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was nice, but the location was absolutely fantastic! We didn't go to any shows there, but there looked like there was some good one's. The guy that checked us in - Elvis - was awesome! The staff there seemed very friendly.
reviews.title: Big rooms & manageable lobby/casino size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we surprised ourselves by going back to bally's,but im sure glad we did we got a free upgrade to the north tower 25th floor room 2570 it was great flat screen tv BIG comfy bed plenty of space for cloths and hangers,maid service brilliant very little noise from rooms either side of us.the room was a smoking room and did smell of smoke but as a smoker this never bothered us.slots seemed to play a bit better casino was packed every night cocktail service was ok but once you gave your first tip they were great(a lot not tipping much) we tipped $5.00 for 3 to 4 drinks and the cocktaills seemed happy with that got we got a great service,i think my only complaint would be the price of the coffee in the mornings $7.00 each which seems a lot when the buffet is only $9.99 but we tended to go gold coast buffet$5.99 or terribles $3.99 we did have a look at bally's buffet but theree wasnt much choice so we didnt stay.but overall a very good 14 days was had.
reviews.title: Good Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from Las Vegas from our honeymoon we spent 7 days 6 nights at Ballys. We were given a king Suite with everything you could possible want in a room. From the hot tub to king bed to safe to what a view of the city this room had it all!!! Would recommend to anyone for the price you cant beat Ballys Las Vegas!!!!! The slot machines are tight at this casino we didnt win anything at all but didnt do too bad at the tables!!!! If you get to vegas stay at Ballys!
reviews.title: Wow What A Great Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ballys was recommended to us for it's location. We upgraded our room to a junior suite and it was MASSIVE! They had executive suites available too but ours was plenty big enough.
reviews.title: Great location mid-strip, clean, helpful staff and plenty to do

likes.liked: — The size of the room, bathroom and the view of the Las Vegas Strip
likes.disliked: — The price of the food in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the south tower. The room had a super king size bed, TV, dining table and chairs, 2 huge comfy chairs and 2 fitted wardrobes either side of the bathroom. The Bathroom had 2 sinks, a sunken bath, a spacious shower, a toilet and a bidet. All in all, it was extremely luxurious. The view from the room overlooked the Paris hotel pool and Eiffel Tower straight on, but if you looked left you could see about 3/4 of the Belagio fountains pool and therefore hear and see most of the fountain shows.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in need of repair!!!

likes.disliked: — lots of repairs and updates needed

reviews.text: Ballys has a extensive casino and loads of restaurants or fast food outlets for getting food, plus downstairs there are a large selection of shops too. I'd recommend the nail bar, I had a mini-manicure and it looked great for days! Go see Bobbi! There's also a pool and access to the Vegas Monorail from the hotel.
reviews.title: Horrendous

reviews.text: I have been in the travel business for many years and I neved had to complain, but the standard of the accomodation at this hotel is the worse I had in all my life (room 7008) is in a very poor condition and I do not understand how they can rent to clients, the carpet is old and all furniture need to be changed.
reviews.title: Rooms very poor

reviews.text: I will never stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location on the strip

likes.disliked: — Restaurants - mediocre food. Go to Paris (sister resort) for better selection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights for getaway with my mom. Was trying to decide between the Paris and Bally's. Decided on Bally's ultimately because of the slight difference in price. Although Paris is a prettier hotel, the 2 hotels are "sister resorts" and connected by the shopping promenade. So you get to enjoy all the common amenities without the cost. Excellent location...centre strip...within walking distance to almost all resorts on the strip. We walked from Circus Circus to MGM Grand over 2 days...bring comfortable shoes!! Definitely pay the extra $$ to stay in the North tower. If you like a quiet room make sure it doesn't face Flamingo Blvd. which has quite heavy traffic. Inner room was extremely quiet...didn't hear a peep from any ajoining rooms, which is very rare. If you book through Expedia and book a deluxe room be sure to bring your confirmation...as often happens with bookings through expedia (in my experience) they don't get the "extra details" with the booking....good to have "proof" right there. Smooth check in...5 minutes wait. Good basic accomodations in terrific location.
reviews.title: Great inexpensive choice in a central location

likes.disliked: — Dirty windows, room service trays left in hallways for days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being newbies to Vegas, I combed through the Vegas Tripadvisor site for suggestions on places to stay. After a few months of research, we decided upon Bally's because we couldn't pass up the deal we were getting through a package deal with Orbitz. Of course, that was for a South Tower room. After a 3-1/2-hour delay in Chicago, we arrived at about 5:45 on Monday, 11-24, to check in. No line at all, walked right up to a younger, apparently new check-in clerk. She was so pleasant! What a joyful way to start a vacation. She was all smiles! I inquired about an upgrade and was told North Tower would be an extra $21.40 a night. Since we were only staying four nights, we agreed. She put us in a "higher" room, 2032, on the 20th floor. Not a bad view...mostly of the distant airport runways but that was fine.
reviews.title: Worked out really well

likes.disliked: — Smoky casino, but what Vegas casino is not smoky?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impression was that room was very clean. Bathroom very large and very clean. Bed was somewhat hard but after long days of walking the strip (along with a 3-hour time change), we literally fell into sleep comas every night regardless. We did have a small coffee pot in our bathroom that made one cup at a time. Who ever heard of such of thing?? I ended up going to Starbucks at Planet Hollywood every morning AFTER I had my one cup in the room. The shower spray KILLED me! I have never had such a strong shower. I actually had to adjust the spray lighter to save my poor skin! All-in-all, I was impressed with the size and cleanliness of the interior of the room although, as previously mentioned, the windows were very dirty on the outside, making the view less appealing.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: There were 10 in our party and we stayed 5 nights at Ballys and were most pleased..We all came from different parts of the country and we were happy that Judy at the check in desk could get us all on the same floor..She was wonderful and so helpful..Ballys is lucky to have such a charmer working with their customers..Most of us were comped for the rooms, but decided to pay an extra $10.00/per night for the North Tower..It is worth the money...Housekeeping did a great job on the rooms each day...They aren't really very updated, but for the "price" and location they are terrific...The casino is small but we walked from Bally's to Paris each day and also saw a couple of shows so gambled in other casinos...Some of the younger gals used the pool a couple of days, altho it was very hot...106 degrees,,,,,,We will go back next year on our annual trip and certainly will make Bally's our headquarters...Everyone was very nice and you can't beat the location..
reviews.title: Back last night from Las Vegas and Bally's.

reviews.text: This hotel has a lot of space for conventions and you can get a little lost, but not too much. The service, food, pool, and rooms are above average for Vas Vegas. The upgraded rooms are also better then average. Great location on strip!!
reviews.title: Very good convention hotel in Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was at a nice location and next to Paris is nice.It is just that this hotel needs updating of rooms that look like 1989 or so.Vegas is fun so we did what was expected, stayed in our room just to sleep on a very uncomfortable bed.
reviews.title: Not much anymore.

reviews.text: I stayed with friends and attended a conference for those who have had weight loss surgery. I asked for help on three occassions and was swiftly helped. Housekeeping did a competent job cleaning up after my friends and I.
reviews.title: Excellent service from all that I encountered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for making my stay in Las Vegas enjoyable.
reviews.title: Needs some freshening up

reviews.text: Every year my company has our annual trade show at Paris and the employees (ie me) stay at Bally's. I think that this hotel is an ok place to stay. It does need upgrading but everything is clean and the service is also good. The location on the strip is excellent. I also enjoyed the spaciousness of the room. If I were traveling to Vegas for pleasure I would definitely think about staying at Bally's. I always ask to stay in the North Tower which is supposedly the more updated wing. I have not been disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location
Good value, choose the North Tower
reviews.text: First of all I got a great price. When I checked in I asked for a room in the North Tower as suggested by several other reviewers. I got a room in the North Tower and it was spacious and clean and furnitures were up to date. Overall it's the nicest hotel room I ever stayed in Vegas.

Bally's was the MGM Grand when it opened in 1973, and while it would be now considered a "senior citizen" on the Strip, it is still one of the nicest hotels available. Large, modern rooms, and spacious common areas were a pleasant surprise to me. The casino is clean and beautiful; the coffee shop serves delicious food in a timely fashion. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Luxury and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to Vegas nearly a dozen times in the last 10 years, and have only stayed in one hotel twice. There are so many places to try that I always like to find something different (as well as get a good deal so I can spend my money elsewhere). I usually lean towards the 'big name' hotels, simply because I know they are going to be safe and clean in a city where those are definitely not givens. I had avoided Bally's in the past mostly due to its age. After reading reviews on here, I decided to give it a shot.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
Good value for Strip location
reviews.text: I was initially irritated upon check-in because, although we arrived on a Thursday evening (thinking it would be quieter than Friday), we were unable to get a non-smoking room as requested. I HATE smoking rooms, but there was really no choice as the hotel was full. The room was a very pleasant surprise. First of all, it was huge. There was a lovely blue velvety couch in the corner with a nice potted plant- just a nice touch. The furniture all looked very new, and the room had obviously been recently renovated. The bed was comfortable enough.

reviews.title: Bally's was just perfect
reviews.text: Our first time to Vegas, and this hotel was perfect. We managed to get a really good deal when we booked. We could not have asked for more. The rooms were modern and very clean. Lots of fresh towels everyday. Bally's is in a central location, connected to the Paris, which is where we spent lots of time having crepes! Across from the Bellagio and easy access to the Monorail, which can help get you from end to end. Day pass was $9, not bad since they come by every 2-3 minutes. If you are in Vegas on a Friday/Saturday night, make sure you visit the Bellagio buffet (it's a gourmet buffet on those nights only) $35.95 a person, but the best buffet in town. Menu had rack of lamb, kobe beef, filet medaillions, peeled jumbo shrimp, opened king crab legs, lobster filled ravioli....and a dessert bar like you have never seen!!! Highly recommend! Also the Paris buffet was wonderful, they make fresh crepes filled with fruit of your choice for breakfast. Lots of really nice cheeses and bread. We disliked the Luxor buffet the most, food was not fresh, and that hotel seemed quite empty. Tried Emeril's restaurant at the MGM Grand, good food, but the servers there are barely 21 years old, seemed like they were in a rush to get you out and get new people in. Caught the David Copperfield show there also, it was entertaining. A must is to see Mystiere (at the Treasure Island hotel) was truely amazing and entertaining. We ate at the Italian restaurant there (Francescos) and the food was great, recommend this one also! The most happening hotel though would have to be the New York, New York, lots of music and dancing, went to the Coyote Ugly there and it was so much fun. There really is lots to do in Vegas, had a great time and would definitely recommend to anyone.

I chose to stay at Bally`s for a conference at Wynn`s because of price and previous good service in the casino. Overall, the quality/price was excellent, with friendly efficient service and a great room for the price. Check-in didn`t start well-I passed the Diamond check-in lounge and the empty Platinum check-in line to join many others in the long line for regular check-in (initlally it looked worse than the US customs line on that particular day). But the line moved fairly fast, and the service I received after a short wait was very friendly and efficient. The room was large, with a very comfortable bed, large well equipped bathroom and nice view of the Strip. Wifi was not available in my room, but they brought up a cable for an excellent high speed connection. The carpet was not new, and there were a few small cracks in the walls, so it wasn`t the new perfection of the Bellagio or other $$$$ hotels, but everything worked well. The shower had a high water pressure that made me understand why there is a water shortage in Nevada! I wandered the food court looking for a good place for dinner without success, but ended up enjoying an excellent quick meal with outstanding, friendly service in the Italian restaurant upstairs. The poker room staff were also uniformly competent and friendly. Yes, when I went to my conference at Wynn`s, the marble everywhere, the new carpets and fixtures were in another class, but still I think I prefer the casual friendly ambience (at 1/3 the price) of Bally`s. I will return to Bally`s and walk to wherever the next conference is held.
reviews.title: great value in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Ballys between 4th Mar-8th Mar 08. Having read other reviews, I decided to try for a North Tower room on check in. Receptionist said there was only 1 Queen room left in North Tower, which had a "pull down" bed. DO NOT LET THIS PUT YOU OFF! We expected a tiny room and requested to change the next day, before viewing the room iteself. However, the room was more of a suite, with 3 piece, dining table etc, plus the bed did not need to be pulled down each night and was always made up ready, so no need to change. TIP: Our safe was broken on the first night, so we were told to use a safety deposit box in the cashier station. Lady there told us to use this for the whole of our stay - which saved us $15!!
reviews.title: Excellent Location Excellent Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend Les Artistes Steakhouse in Paris - best steaks ever! (go to Tix4tonight to get 50% reduction on mains).
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also try and see David Copperfield @ MGM Grand if you can - amazing!! Studio 54 in MGM is great for a late drink / dance.
reviews.title: Bathroom with a bed in it

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location on the strip. The room was a bit dated but clean with more space that you could possibly need. Good breakfast buffet and pool area. Casino was pretty standard but we're not big gamblers anyway. Only downside was the hike though the casino with luggage to find the elevators to our room. Would stay again if the rate was right.
reviews.title: Good Location
Great Casino
reviews.text: We stayed at Ballys Casino from 11/20 to 11/25. We checked in at the airport without any problems. We had a room on the 15th floor in the North Tower which was ready when we arrived Sunday morning. The room was great, larger than most rooms, very clean and beds were very comfortable. Ballys is centrally located on the strip. For the working class people the price is much better than staying at the top casinos just because they are newer and fancier. After all, you are not buying the property, just staying for a few nights. I liked the friendliness of all the people, dealers as well as players. Only negative was eating the buffet in the Big Kitchen. By far it was the worse buffet I have seen in Vegas or Atlantic City. Food was cold and tasteless. It wasn't even worth wasting our comps on it. If you want a great, reasonable place to eat, you must try Ellis Island Casino and Brewery on Koval 2 blocks behind Ballys. Breakfast which included bacon or sausage, eggs, potatoes, and toast was $2.95. Their 24 hour special is a 10 oz. sirloin filet, salad, baked potato and green beans for $4.95. It was as good as anything on the strip for $20. All their meals were fantastic. Check out Ballys and Ellis Island for a great week.

reviews.title: Thumbs Up for Bally's
reviews.text: My husband and I returned yesterday after staying at Bally's for 4 days/3 nights. As soon as you walk into the hotel lobby you're blinded by the lights and dazzle of the gold rimmed stairs.

Although our package offered a standard room we were upgraded at no extra charge to a honeymoon suite on the 24th floor in the north tower! It was the biggest room we had ever seen! The hotel staff were friendly and hospitable.
reviews.title: Not glitzy but great in most other ways

reviews.text: The hotel is situated centrally on the strip which was great as we could choose which part of the strip we wished to explore without having to walk too much.
reviews.title: Interesting Place
Stayed there in May 2007
reviews.text: We just returned home from staying at Bally's in Las Vegas. If you should go there, DO NOT stay in rooms in the South Tower that end in 06. They back on to the elevators and you do not sleep any at night as you hear them go up and down during the hours you should be sleeping. They also have weird bathrooms. We were moved the next morning to the North Tower and everything was great after that. I would stay again, but not in the South Tower. We did not eat at Bally's so I can not comment on the food service. The staff, though, were very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Surprisingly good. We had a spacious room with a good view. The double sided desk was good for working, a separate comfy chair with reading lamp. The marble bath area was large. There was a separate vanity area. Plenty of closet/drawer space.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good.

likes.disliked: — casino floor is smaller than most hotels

reviews.text: It's easy to get everywhere from this central location. We had the north tower and have stayed at more expensive hotels that had less desirable rooms and staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel...Would Definately Stay There Again

reviews.text: The check in/out staff was courteous and quick.
reviews.title: View vs. Room Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ballys during the last week of April 2007 and had a wonderful time. I had read some reviews on this site and was unsure what the hotel would be like. However, it was very good.
reviews.title: Great stay in a crazy city

likes.liked: — Location and price. And the beds were lovely!

reviews.title: Bally's in Las Vegas has poor sercurity system and bad management style
reviews.text: we have been Las Vegas for so many times, but first time stayed at Bally's. My husband lost his pants and cellphone at Swimming pool. They couldn't find the thief because their survaliance system not working. After we reported to the hotel manager, they just say " Sorry, but there is nothing they can do about it. " They leted us deal with the claim department, which is end up we're not qulified for anything. We will never go back to stay at Bally's again. Terrible! Terrible!! Terrible experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ballys for our first trip to Las Vegas. The location was great. We could walk to just about everyplace we wanted to go. Took the bus a couple of times. The hotel was clean and comfortable. No problems with check in, housekeeping etc. The outside pool area looked nice, but it was too cold to use it- closed for the season anyway. They have a shuttle that takes you to the airport for a nominal fee- cheaper than a taxi. Not much of a gambler but had fun playing slots.
reviews.title: great location

likes.disliked: — no place for a quick, inexpensive breakfast

reviews.text: I'm late writing this review but we booked 2 rooms at Bally's for December 30th to January 2nd. We paid $115 a night for each room, booked on hotel website, which was a really great deal for the New Years holiday. Both rooms were in the south tower on opposite sides of the hallway 71st floor. Check in was fast and friendly. The rooms are the biggest standard size rooms I have ever stayed in. The bathroom is also larger than average. The decor is slightly outdated but really for that price who cares. Views were really nice. One room had a nice view of the Bellagio fountains and of the Eifel Tower. Rooms were always cleaned thoroughly and pretty promptly too. The staff throughout the hotel and casino is super friendly. I found the location to be ideal, pretty close to being center strip. Bally's is connected to Paris as well which was nice and you are able to cash chips in at either casino. We had breakfast at The Sidewalk Cafe. The prices were very reasonable, the food was good, and the service was excellent. They also have a cafe at the bottom of the elevators called Java Coast which is open 24 hours. They had good food and coffee but the prices are a little high there. I paid $4 for a small bottle of Dole OJ. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. All 4 in our group had a blast on our trip and our experience at Bally's contributed to that.
reviews.title: Very satisfied

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, resonable room rates, and location

reviews.text: I had a great experience at Bally's. I booked a room in the South Tower but they upgraded me to the North Tower without even asking. The room was very clean and large. I did not have to wait long at check in. The best thing about Bally's is their central location. I am looking forward to going back sometime.
reviews.title: great experience

likes.disliked: — it was a long walk from room to the strip

reviews.text: My brother and I travelled to Las Vegas to attend our cousin's wedding. When planning the trip, I was up in the air about Bally's and the Imperial, and in the end, chose Bally's, and was glad I did. Other guests of the wedding that we were attending stayed at the Imperial and would have switched hotels if they could have. It was a real dive. They spent as much time out of the hotel that they could and only returned to sleep.
reviews.title: Would Definately Stay Here Again

reviews.text: I had a perfectly pleasant stay at Bally's and recommend it to anyone on a budget. It is a middle-aged full service value hotel in the Caeser's group located at the very center of the strip. The website room photos are accurate. The rooms are huge (450 sq. ft.), but a little under-furnished for the amount of space. They could do so much more with them if they wanted to. The room was quiet. The bed was quite comfortable. I had an enormous bathroom and closet/dressing room, large flatscreen, iron, safe, climate control, sofa-lounge, and workdesk. The lighting in the room was good. The staff was good and efficient. The hotel gives a voucher that is good at any Caesar's property. I wasn't impressed by Bally's breakfast buffet. No yoghurts or cereals. Overall, the hotel is very clean and pleasant, but it needs a bit of upgrading. The buildings and furniture are showing wear and tear. The water from the tap has an odd taste. Like all Vegas hotels, you need you review your bill for unexpected charges. They tried to bill me for safe rental, but I never used it, so they reversed the charge. Also, they ding you for early check-in. I've read a lot of Vegas reviews complaining about lack of free internet, lack of a kettle, etc. in most of the hotels. The simple fact is that NOTHING is free in Vegas. It is all about spending, not giving. Esoecially if you stay on the strip, you are a captive of major enterprises. Nothing is cheap and there are no corner mini markets like back home. It's no use complaining about it. They won't change their policies because they don't have to. So, just accept that, plan for it, and enjoy yourself.
reviews.title: Best location, comfortable but not luxurious

reviews.text: I had a three night stay at Bally's recently, because I'm a Total Rewards member the rooms were comp'd...good things about the hotel: Rooms were large and clean, soft towels, comfortable beds, fluffy pillows and extra linens for a good night's sleep. Hotel location is excellent, on the strip next to the Flamingo, Paris, Belagio and Ceasar's. Bad things about this hotel: 20 minutes to check-in...long line of people and only 3 front desk staff, really? $14 a day for wi-fi service seemed excessive since most hotels I've ever stayed in includes internet. Only 17 or so "real" tv channels, all the rest are casino information, chinese and spanish chanels, and no premium chanels (not even basic HBO). Also, didn't win ANYTHING, games seemed rigged to take my money without even a token win.
reviews.title: An average stay at an average hotel on the strip

reviews.text: Booked a one night stay at Ballys on my last night in LV. I had gotten a deal through Orbitz for $44 and with no resort fees like most places charge, I thought it was a steal.
reviews.title: Will stay again

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel around 2pm. Line was rather long but there were enough people working reception that the wait was not too bad, about 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was easy, but because of the time, if I wanted a room right away, I was going to be charged a $10 early check in fee. Because I was wiped and really wanted to lay down, I was fine with paying the $10 fee. The lady checking me in asked if I wanted to upgrade to their newer renovated rooms in the North Tower because I had a "Classic" room reserved in the South Tower. The upgrade charge was $20 but they would waive the $10 early check in. After asking her point blank how bad the rooms were, she in not-so-many-words suggested I upgrade as the classic rooms were pretty old (almost 20 years). Well, turns out if you are a total rewards member (which I am), you get the upgrade for $10. Since I was paying this anyway, why not?
reviews.title: Short Getaway
Great value. Excellent location
reviews.text: We were in Vegas for three days at Tropicana then went to California. We had to fly back to Canada thru Vegas so we returned for one more night. It was the Monday on Memorial Day weekend so most people were leaving. We wanted to try something new but keep it under $70. So we gave Ballys a whirl. Solid choice. Laid back atmosphere, beautiful pool area and perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a room for $49 and after a tip of $20 we were upgraded to the Diamonds floor and had a nice renovated room in the North tower. Very quiet area and we could still see the strip and Bellagio water fountains!
reviews.title: 4 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative was long lines to check in. I will say I thought the service was hit and miss. Our bell lady was amazing. Our clerk was super friendly but I did see some bell guys acting a bit unprofessional.
reviews.title: See The Price is Right game show!

reviews.text: Overall? Definitely recommend!
reviews.title: Great Location Great Value

reviews.text: I stayed at Bally's 2 weeks ago and enjoyed my stay. If I go back to Vegas I will definatley stay there again. I stayed in the North tower, which had 2 queen beds. I wanted 1 king bed, but none were available so I had to get the 2 queen beds. The room was large and the casino was nice too. I ate at Tequila bar. I had 2 $2 tacos. They were okay. I would buy something different if I ate there again. The pool was nice sized. It was up to 13 feet deep in some areas. I liked how Ballys is connect to Paris, so there was no need to walk on the strip to go to the Paris. There was one negative thing on my visit. There were 2 glass cups that had a pink lipstick stain on the rim. I had not drank out of the glasses, so they must have not been washed correctly.
reviews.title: Great price, good location.

reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed at Ballys during our last trip and really enjoyed our stay. Good location and access to other hotels like Paris. It's an older hotel but still worth a look.
reviews.title: Good location for Vegas

reviews.text: This was our 2nd Visit to Ballys and we would go again, it has everything Bars, Restaurants, and the rooms are really nice, very clean and spacious - we stayed in the North Tower. Would highly recomend this hotel as a good base for everything due to the fact that it is more or less in the middle of The Strip.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did alot of research before booking my trip to Las Vegas as this was our first time there. I was hesitant at first about booking at Ballys as the reviews were somewhat mixed, but for the price we got and the location, I thought I had nothing to lose. We stayed from May 8th to May 15th. We had a great stay. Our room was in the South Tower, 5th floor. We had an excellent view of Paris, Eiffel Tower and the strip. Our room and bathroom were huge. Both were very clean. The furniture, TV, etc. is a little dated, but we were only there to sleep. The location can't be beat...it was right across from the Bellagio and attached to Paris. The service we received was excellent. From the time we checked in at the front desk, to the Bell desk, restaurants, house keeping, it was fantastic service.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great Value for your Money

reviews.text: There were only a few of negatives, in my opinion. I found the walk, to the pool quite far and you had to go through the Casino to get there. The entire time we were there one of the moving walkways was broken in the front of the hotel, which after a long day of walking was a bit of an inconvenience and no one seemed to quick on fixing it. Lastly there was no coffee maker in the room and the coffee downstairs was quite costly.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.text: Other than that, our stay was great....we would definetly stay at Ballys again.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Good!!!
