reviews.text: My first time at Bally's and the place looks lovely. I had the perfect view of the Eifel Tower, and the amenites were acceptable. However, the employees were rude when there was a problem that needed to be addressed that included an error of an employee. Instread of helping me, they played dumb and they ignored me. The manager never came to help, AND they hung up on me in my room. I was overcharged and wasnt even allowed to complete my stay. Lovely place..... very lovely. But I will not be staying there ever again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, rude employees

reviews.text: Stayed in the North Tower, room was large and clean. Had a problem with the internet service the 1st morning technician was up within 15 minutes and had it fixed shortly thereafter. Had a light out in the bathroom again the maintenance person was there within 15 minutes and had it fixed. Staff was friendly. 1st time staying at Bally's and you can't beat the location.
reviews.title: Nice room great service

reviews.text: Only complaint is that the Casino was smokey but you are so close to so many other hotels it was easy to find a less smokey environment.
reviews.title: Bally's has definately changed...

likes.disliked: — uncomfortable pillows and difficulty keeping the room temperature constant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dealers were friendly but the best fun gambling was had at Planet Hollywood next door. Visit the passion pit after 9 and you will have a great time.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect!

reviews.text: We recently stayed for 3 nights. We booked the North Tower as we were aware that the South Tower contained rooms that had not been renovated. The rooms were great. They were large and clean. The beds were not horrible but the pilllows left me with a stiff neck every day.
reviews.title: Problem Resolved by Good Manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 3 night stay at Bally's was great! The room and bathroom were very clean and spacious. We were on the 19th floor and the view from our window wasn't anything spectacular but we weren't in Vegas for the room view! Our room was also very quiet! The access to the strip is awesome and the little mexican restuarant inside Ballys had $1 dollar maragita's and $2 cuervo shots or beers ALL THE TIME!! We did an air/hotel package deal and our hotel ended up being about 51 dollars a night! Now that's a STEAL for a 450 sq ft clean room and bathroom! No matter what time we can in from the strip, the staff was always very friendly and helpful! Check in was a breeze! We were pleasantly surprised when they gave us a coupon book with hundreds of discounts in it and we didn't even ask for it! All in all our stay at Bally's was better than we expected and we will stay there again the next time we go to Vegas! Rowlands - Bellingham, WA
reviews.title: PERFECT for what we needed!!

reviews.text: previous reviews seemed to indicate that negative reviews came from travelers in need of refurbished rooms versus positive reviews for those in newer rooms. I was a bit concerned, but my room turned out to be very spacious, clean and up to date. It was cleaned daily and towels were replaced even when trying to participate with conservation program hotels often recommend. No complaints for the fresh towels.
reviews.title: great location and good service - but needs to hire staff and repair escalators & moving sidewalks

reviews.text: I did eat at the breakfast buffet and found that the wait time to be a bit long, and then to discover once inside, that sections of the restaurant weren't open. Perhaps hiring more staff would resolve that problem. The food was ok, limited selections, but the buffet was a good price. You also have the option of ordering off the menu. There are several restaurants in the hotel, plus the hotel is linked to the Paris hotel, with also several restaurant choices.
reviews.title: Bally's is not spectacular, but it is comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were issues with escalators and moving sidewalks not working. One sign pointed to an elevator, but the elevator was not working. It was very hot for this time of year, and having working escalators is important.
reviews.title: Great Staff
Be Prepared for Bizarre Human Interaction
reviews.text: In fairness to Bally's, there were similar issues at another hotel and with the escalators at the overhead crossings, of course the one at Bally's crossing to the Bellagio, so it was more obvious and frustrating .

reviews.title: LV Trip Report 9/19 - 9/23 Bally's, LV Shows, & Buffets
reviews.text: Thanks A Lot For The Info Received From The Bally's & Las Vegas Forums!
We Just Returned From Sept 19-23 Vacation @ Bally's In Las Vegas -"Armed" With The Advise of Bally's & LV TripAdvisor Forum Folks In Advance -
reviews.title: We all agree....South Tower stinks

reviews.text: We Arrived At Bally's At 11 PM Following A $13 (+ $2 Tip) 15-Minute Taxi Ride From McCarran Airport. We Were First In Line At Bally's Registration Desk. (Thru-Out Our Stay There Was Almost Always A Que Line of Up To 20 People There).
reviews.title: great time

reviews.text: When Bally's Desk Clerk Mentioned They Only Had 1 Room Left
reviews.title: Bally's was great!
Nice hotel
reviews.text: In The South Tower With My Requested View of The Bellagio Fountains

I recently stayed here for 2 nights with a friend. I had reserved a South Tower room, but upon check-in, we were given a North Tower room, which I think is supposed to be nicer. The room was very nice - clean, spacious, nice furniture, granite bathroom. There are express elevators to floor 16 and up, which we used and they always came quickly. We had a westward view of Rio and towards the Strip. My only small quibbles were that the bed linens could have been softer and more comfortable, but I still slept fine. And the bathroom only had about 3 toiletries: sham/con, lotion and soap. Nothing else. But given the great location of Bally's and the nice room, I'd stay there again anytime. Room was nice and quiet - no street noise.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice stay

reviews.text: Where do I start?? I went for the Vemma Royale Convention which was held at Bally's hotel in Vegas. I drove from San Diego, got there about 3:30 am, checked in and went to bed. Next day we went to lunch and my credit card declined!! Bally's had charged my card almost $400 IN ADDITION to what I had already payed to stay there for 3 nights! I went to the front desk, they apologized said they will take care of their "mistake" To make a very long story as short as possible, they never fixed the problem. They over drew my bank account, so all bills I had paid prior to going bounced, I had no $ whatsoever for the entire weekend, not even to eat! after many managers, supervisors and a whole lot of stress, all they can do is offer me 2 tickets to Jubillee their show! im sorry but how about some FOOD!? They finally gave me $100 food credit for the weekend until they can reverse the charges they added to my card. Well, I wasn't even able to go to my training class for Vemma which was the purpose of my trip because of dealing with what they did to me. trying to straighten things out. NOTHING GOT STRAIGHTENED OUT. Just a bunch of empty promises. I didnt have enough gas to get back home, but they didnt care. I had to borrow money from someone to get home 3 days later. They promised to credit everything back, plus all my overdraft fees which now total over $400!! It is now 2 WEEKS LATER and guess what??? I AM STILL NEGATIVE IN MY BANK, have went thru hell these past 2 weeks, got my cell phone shut off, my husbands phone is shut off, everything is a mess because of their "mistake" and have caused me a lot of emotional stress and completely broke and not knowing what to do. they havent given me the credit they promised and i dont understand why. what is so hard about fixing the mistake when they are such a big company?? im extremely pissed off and have a constant headache. I have now moved up to corporate i am tired of dealing with people who don't knw what they are doing..im done! This has been the worst trip i have ever taken to Vegas!! THANKS ALOT BALLY'S MANAGERS! by the way, I hope the staff feels good about me having to take my kids to eat at my moms because i cant even afford to buy them a double cheeseburger for .99 cents! and im not kidding! This is a true story! BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU STAY THERE, CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARDS/DEBIT CARDS RIGHT AWAY...SOO SOOO SAD..
reviews.title: Bally's RUINED my ENTIRE weekend!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My H and I arrived in Vegas on Thursday morning of 1/22/09 at 9:45am. When we arrived at McCarran, I discovered that one of my bags was missing. That started the trip on a downer, but I was sure they would find my bag eventually.
reviews.title: Bally's a Great Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had hired a car to pick us up. The driver was at baggage claim awaiting our arrival. All went smooth. We arrived at Bally's in a timely manner.
reviews.title: Consider this hotel

likes.disliked: — Older property, lots of cigarette smoke in lobby/casino area

reviews.text: I will go through the major topics. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask. I am a new Diamond member. We reserved our hotel from 1/22-25 and received 2 comp days and had to pay $85 for the Saturday night.
reviews.title: Cheap & basically clean, but some downsides, too
Great hotel, even better location
reviews.text: I stayed in Bally's for five nights at the end of December and was completely satisfied. Both the room and bathroom were very spacious and spotlessly clean. The weekday rates of $60 per night made me a little wary before check-in but I had no need to be it was an absolute bargain. I travelled over with a friend for the marathon who had pre-booked at Circus Circus. I'll not comment much on that place only to say read the reviews, pay a little extra and stay in Bally's - it's in a different league.

Bally's is a little more understated than the rest of the hotels on the strip with no overall 'Disney World' style theme, this is subjective I know but I prefered it and of course it is reflected in their great rates. Besides within a two minute stroll along a connecting arcade your in the Paris casino and you've got Ballagio, Caesars, Mirage etc just over the strip all within five minute walk, not to mention the monorail station attached which connects you to the farther reaches of the strip. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: New Year Special

reviews.text: We stayed at Ballys over new year last year and had a fantastic time! The hotel is very well located and our room overlooked the strip and the Bellagio. The strip was closed to traffic on new years eve and everyone was out partying. Would definitely stay here again and excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Bally's is a great place to stay
Bally's was great!
reviews.text: For only $69 a night I wasn't really expecting much form Bally's. When we arrived at the airport we were able to check in to the hotel right there (Ceasars has a desk at the airport and bally's guests can check in there also). Even though check in was really until 3pm they let us check in at 11am for no extra charge. Once we got to the hotel and saw the room it by far exceeded my expectations. It was about 600 sq. ft. and there was a chaise lounge, a desk, TV, safe, HUGE bathroom, and great view. We ordered room service the next morning and it was pretty good, a little expensive but all room service is. The Casino itself left more to be desired. Not many table games, and nothing under $10. The slots were ok but I wish there were more pennies and nickels. Food at the restaurant was good but a little pricey. Location was AWESOME though. Right dead center on the strip and across the street from Ceasars and Bellagio. We could see the fountain show from our room (a liitle obstructed though) and walking everywhere was a breeze. Just bring good shoes. Lastly I would just recommend that you stop by either Ceasars or the Aladdin for a Frozen drink at Fat Tuesdays, it was out of this world!!!

reviews.title: Will not stay at Bally's again.
reviews.text: Bally's was a great hotel for the money. Right in the middle of the strip, neighboring Flamingo, Caesars Palace, Bellagio, Paris. You cannot beat it for the price! I would defintely stay there again.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: Fifth time in Vegas, first time at Ballys, usually stay at the Imperial. Rooms were better than Imperial so were the elevators, nightmare at the Imperial. Check in and out was very quick. Rooms were great. Casino was good. We ate in on one occasion and the food was good. Used the coffee shop a lot. Everything was excellent and would stay there again.

Bally's has a great mid-Strip location, and it has become our favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. The rooms are spacious, they have big windows, and they are tastefully decorated. Several nearby hotels have rooms that are more luxuriously decorated, but they are also much smaller with peek-a-boo windows.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Hotel in Las Vegas

reviews.text: Requests made to housekeeping are responded to immediately.
reviews.title: Nice big room

reviews.text: The valet parking service is excellent.
reviews.title: Excellant Location
POKER BARS ARE GREAT
reviews.text: During the week, rooms are often available in the $80-$90 range. In September we paid $79 on Thursday and $169 on Friday. We thought it was a great deal.

Went to Vegas from May 11 - 15 with a few buddies as a roommate reunion from college. We are all in our mid to late 30's now. So we weren't looking for party all the time, but we weren't looking for stuffy, deadness either. Ballys is awesome. Its more blue collar than flash and dash, but we are pretty regular joes so we weren't looking for high end. I mean how much are you really in your room anyway. I personally organized the trip was the only one of the 5 who had been to Vegas before. The other times I have been I have stayed at Imperial Palace and Harrahs. All 3 of these hotels are part of the same chain. But to me Ballys blows them away for a few simple reasons.
reviews.title: The Real Deal

reviews.text: 1. Staff. So friendly and helpful. Asked for an upgrade, did the best she could at front desk, was so thorough and helpful about it. It was full that weekend (mothers day) so the upgrade was minimal but she helped us none the less. Also the bellhops and regular casino staff were great too whenever we had questions. Cleaning staff as well. Awesome. Left a couple singles on the counter every morning. More than clean. Perfect.
reviews.title: Okay. But that's about it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Location. Its money in the bank. Right on the South East corner of Flamingo and LVBoulevard. Best location ever. So easy to get anywhere from there. Although it is a bit of a walk from the casino to the strip corner. But whatever. Gotta work off the food anyway.
reviews.title: Excellent Service/Would stay again

reviews.text: Bally's is centrally-located on the Strip, and that was my primary reason for choosing to stay there. There's a monorail stop that was convenient for me to get to my conference location, and for my traveling companion to do tourist-y things on her own.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, though not lavish. We had everything we needed for our stay. The room looked like it had some upgrades done, esp. in the bathroom and the workspace. The carpet still looks dated, but it was clean.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price for this hotel is a good value for its location and for the quality of the room. It's not a WOW, but you won't be disappointed if you want a clean place to stay with everything you need.
reviews.title: loved the beds

reviews.text: We have just returned from a three night visit to Bally's - I was a bit nervous due to the mixed reviews bit shouldn't have been. Check in was a breeze and we received exactly the type of room we asked for.I found all the staff members to be outstanding - polite and professional. The mid strip location can not be beat and the connection to Paris hotel is a plus.
reviews.title: Nice room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Bally's over the busy 5-5-7 weekend. I was a little worried because of the dated exterior, but room in north tower was clean and beds were very comfy. Actually a better room than a standard room at Caesars. Check in and check out staff were ok, did their job and nothing more. We had good luck at the blackjack tables, but cocktail waitresses were few and far between. Great location. Loved the connection to the Paris, like staying at 2 different hotels. Very good value if you want to save some money for shopping, eating and gambling.
reviews.title: Bally's rivals any luxury hotel in Las Vegas!!

reviews.text: I knew what I was getting into but I hoped the view would be spectacular since these old suites were once top of the line. Unfortunately they put me as far away from the strip as you can get so no people-watching. I didn't have the nerve to ask for a change since they let me check in way early. The furniture was old enough to be American made and the finishes were ok. Couple lamp shade issues. I think there are larger versions of these suites cause I saw on the internet some with separate BR and a bar area. A vasty inefficient use of space at 830 sq. ft. A 20' long narrow entryway into one large BR adjoining an inboard elevated open bathroom area with opposing vanities and separate bidet and toilet rooms. Recessed tub in the middle. 60's lavish. The bathroom was elevated so they could recess the tub. Now that's trying too hard. Tons of railings and motion sensor lighting so you don't get up at night to pee and fall into the tub. I had a lovely bath--plenty of bright white towels--but I couldn't get out of the tub (66yo). It seemed narrow and I couldn't turn sideways for leverage. I cleverly drained the water so I wouldn't drown if I hit my head fighting out. Enclosed shower center back but 40 year old tiles looked risky. One of my room keys zeroed and I learned don't carry it near your cellphone. That's why. The carpet was ok clean. I would have been a happy camper except for the bad luck of being buried so far back from the strip (even beyond the elevator). Almost immediately I knew I had not found a new home despite my love of big rooms. Bally's has some big decisions to make on this excellent location. Everything was acceptable. Food to go is a challenge here.
reviews.title: south tower grand suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were allocated Room 2558 facing east towards the mountains and airport. The bonus being it was ready at 13.00. Nice big room, same as previous North Tower room, but with a new Panasonic flat screen TV. Tried out the safe, forgetting that they charge $3 / day.
reviews.title: Another good stay, nothing flashy, but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt that the furnishings were a bit worn for a refurbished room, but the room was really large, at least 450 sq ft, even larger than other Vegas rooms. It had a king bed (6ft wide), 2 seater sofa, easy chair, coffee table, 2 desks, another small table.
reviews.title: Fun times

reviews.text: Bally's is an older hotel, but their rooms are large and it's in a great central location, opposite the Bellagio and close to Caesars Palace.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Place on the main strip

reviews.text: Rooms are not as nice as MGM and the higher end hotels, but the price reflects this. It is better than the Imperial Palace.
reviews.title: Friendly staff & very memorable 21st!!!!

reviews.text: I'm writing this review while staying at Ballys. This has been our third time here. Yes, there are two towers and the south tower is the non-renovated one. Unfortunately this tower is more convenient to the meeting rooms and they also face the midstrip so you'll get excellent views of the Bellagio dancing fountains and the "Eiffel Tower". Therefore, we always request a south tower room. The above are the great things about our Ballys stay.
reviews.title: The good and bad of Ballys
Bally's
reviews.text: Now for the bad:

Rooms need renovating and maintenance: The south tower rooms dearly need renovating and maintaining. The decor is past being tired and worn. Currently the decor is circa 1980's. Our other bathrooms in the south tower were allright, but during our current stay the bathroom, while fine with the large marble countertop, needs to be renovated immediately. The shower is horrible with the head missing part of the spray attachment so you get blasted with a 'fire hose' effect, there is terrible moldy grout between the (white) tiles, the shower door has seen better days, and the ceiling light/fan fixture is missing a cover.
reviews.title: Another great Bally's stay!
Buyer Beware!
reviews.text: Poor housekeeping: No good housekeeping is available at Ballys. At least in our current room there isn't. Room service menus were taken out from the hotel info. binder but were not replaced. Laundry bags were not replaced as well. The room had terrible dust next to and behind the beds and anywhere that's not in the forefront; obviously the housekeepers are not doing a good job.

Hear and feel every noise: The rooms have zero insulation so you hear every single movement, TV show, and conversation (including arguments). You can hear door slamming from not only your next door neighbors but also from your fellow guests down the hallway. Guests are so stupid and disrespectful of other guests that they allow their doors to slam and bang no matter what hour of the day or night and the noise resonates in your room. Kids and adults run up and down the corridors and this is very disturbing too. Our next door neighbors were slamming their doors from 11 p.m. to 2 a.m. and also their kids (?) were running around inside the room for a while. We tried to sleep but would be awakened rudely with the noises. As it went on for hours we had to call security to have them talk to them.
reviews.title: bally's - no complaints

reviews.text: Just returning from a conference in Vegas where we enjoyed our 1st stay at Bally's. The hotel is in the most central location and the staff could not have been any friendlier.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location and Friendly Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked a room through the conference and wasn't quite sure what it would be for the price especially after reading some of the reviews on here. However, we were given our choice of three room types upon arrival. Our room was in the North Tower and was very clean. It had a single queen bed, a dining table and 4 chairs, a smaller table w/ 2 chairs, a couch, chair, desk and coffee table. It also had a desk, fridge dressing area and large bathroom.
reviews.title: Great time at Ballys !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet was available for $11.99/day but only worked the first 3 of the 5 days we were there. Now for a complaint - we called and were told they would come up but did not. Had we been there any longer, we would have called again.
reviews.title: Very nice....Great location

reviews.text: The only other complaint might be that housekeeping was way too eager to clean the room daily.
reviews.title: nice hotel in a great location

reviews.text: For those who tend to be overly critical -
reviews.title: Adequate But Not With Children

likes.disliked: — The fact it was in Las Vegas!

reviews.text: Stayed of Bally's because of the great location! You're near a lot of great hotels within a short walk away. Got a free upgrade to a North Tower room (just ask at registration desk). It was a very clean and huge room with nice comfy bed. Not impressed with their casino or service at casino but who needs Bally's when there's lots of others nearby!Next time I go back I'll definately stay there again!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Loved this place! Got a great deal online (be sure to check their websites if your travel dates are flexible), and the location in the middle of the strip is perfect for exploring both ends by foot - plus there is a monorail station right outside if you get tired, shuttle to off strip hotels like the Rio! Very friendly and helpful front desk too. Also liked the fact that it was joined to Paris so that you could use some of their amenities (business services etc).
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second trip to Vegas and my husband I had a very different experience. We stayed at Bally's for two nights($84.00 a night June). The check in line was extremely long and when we got to our room we had an okay view and an okay room. Nothing like the MGM ($98.00 a night in October), which we stayed at for our first visit to Vegas, very chic, but not too stuffy. Overall, the stay at Bally's was decent, however the shower was a disaster. It was like camping, there was just a lonely old shower curtain that "kept" the water from escaping the stall. After every shower we had to tend to cleaning duty by mopping up the floor :(
reviews.title: Okay stay for two nights

likes.disliked: — the shower & long check- in line

reviews.text: Good thing our stay was for a wedding. I don't recommend this hotel for a vacation. MGM & Paris are a great bet.
reviews.title: Excellent location on the strip, and a great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Bally's was good overall. You cannot beat the location, central on the strip (Bellagio, Caesar's and Flamingo across the street. Also an easy walk to the Venetian). And you cannot beat the price. We had two rooms in the North Tower and were quite pleased with them. The shower pressure could have been a lot better though.
reviews.title: Contrary to Reviews...Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Tight Slots - like all Vegas Casionos these days

reviews.text: While we were upgraded to the north tower and the pool was awsome. I was very dissatisfied with the casino area of this property because it stunk horribly of cigarettes. As my wife and I visited other casinos on the strip we noticed many used air fresheners to elliminate cigarette oders. Overall our experience was good, but did not spend anytime in the casino at bally's.
reviews.title: Stinky casino
A nice "middle of the road" place to stay
reviews.text: As everyone has stated, its an older hotel. Its not the fanciest place on the strip, but the price is right. If you need fancy, go across the street to the Bellagio.

I checked in early around 9am, there was no line at the front desk. I was upgraded to a North Tower Jr. Suite, which is really not much different from a standard room except the bathroom is much bigger and there is a velvet wall for the headboard by the bed.
reviews.title: Bally's Viva Las Vegas

reviews.text: Honestly I don't really have many complaints. Just stay away from the people in purple shirts, they are selling timeshares and will ask you EVERY time you walk through the lobby. Also, later in the day the front desk lines are ridiculous, they need to look at the staffing levels during peak times. Check in/out early if you can.
reviews.title: Ballys May2012

reviews.text: The location is great. All the big attractions are within walking distance. The staff was very accommodating in the various interactions I had with them. I ate at the restaurants in Paris which is so close to the North Tower it feels like its in the lobby of Bally's. Overall a satisfying experience.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

aka: Bally`s Las Vegas Hotel Las Vegas
description: True classics never go out of style, making Bally’s the only choice for classic Vegas at the heart of the Strip. And what could be more timeless than playing The Price Is Right – Live! for fabulous prizes? This stage version of the classic television game show puts audience members in the middle of the action with all your favorite games from Plinko to the Showcase Showdown. As night falls, sophistication and showgirls await you at Jubilee!, the last authentic showgirl extravaganza in Vegas. Dining options at Bally’s include SEA The Thai Experience offering delicious cuisine from southeast Asia and the Bally’s Steakhouse. Gracious service is the hallmark of the indulgent Sterling Brunch, where caviar, sushi, lobster and other gourmet dishes are served along with premium champagne every Sunday. Just steps away you’ll find the luxurious Paris Las Vegas with its own brand of dining, shopping and entertainment.
